answers.answer: When to Seek Medical CareYou have a boil and start running a fever.The skin around the boil turns red or red streaks appear.The pain becomes severe.The boil does not drain.A second boil appears.You have a heart murmur, diabetes, any problem with your immune system, or are taking medications that suppress the immune system (for example, corticosteroids or chemotherapy for cancer) and you develop a boil.Boils usually do not require immediate emergency attention. If you are in poor health and you develop high fever and chills along with the infection, a trip to a hospital's emergency department is needed.
